trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Blob storage from Python | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Blob storage from Python | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Blob storage from Python to upload, list, download, and delete blobs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Blob storage from Python to upload, list, download, and delete blobs.

trans-unit.source: This article will show you how to perform common scenarios using Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: This article will show you how to perform common scenarios using Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in Python and use the <linkText>Python Azure Storage package</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in Python and use the <linkText>Python Azure Storage package</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include uploading, listing, downloading, and deleting blobs.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include uploading, listing, downloading, and deleting blobs.

trans-unit.source: If you need to install Python or the <linkText>Python Azure package</linkText><title></title>, see the <linkText>Python Installation Guide</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to install Python or the <linkText>Python Azure package</linkText><title></title>, see the <linkText>Python Installation Guide</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The BlobService object lets you work with containers and blobs.
trans-unit.target: The BlobService object lets you work with containers and blobs.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a BlobService object.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a BlobService object.

trans-unit.source: Add the following near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Add the following near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a BlobService object using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a BlobService object using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.

trans-unit.source: In the following code example, you can use a BlobService object to create the container if it doesn't exist.
trans-unit.target: In the following code example, you can use a BlobService object to create the container if it doesn't exist.

trans-unit.source: By default, the new container is private, so you must specify your storage access key (as you did earlier) to download blobs from this container.
trans-unit.target: By default, the new container is private, so you must specify your storage access key (as you did earlier) to download blobs from this container.

trans-unit.source: If you want to make the files within the container available to everyone, you can create the container and pass the public access level using the following code.
trans-unit.target: If you want to make the files within the container available to everyone, you can create the container and pass the public access level using the following code.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can modify a container after you have created it using the following code.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can modify a container after you have created it using the following code.

trans-unit.source: After this change, anyone on the Internet can see blobs in a public container, but only you can modify or delete them.
trans-unit.target: After this change, anyone on the Internet can see blobs in a public container, but only you can modify or delete them.

trans-unit.source: To upload data to a blob, use the put\_block\_blob\_from\_path, put\_block\_blob\_from\_file, put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes or put\_block\_blob\_from\_text methods.
trans-unit.target: To upload data to a blob, use the put\_block\_blob\_from\_path, put\_block\_blob\_from\_file, put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes or put\_block\_blob\_from\_text methods.

trans-unit.source: They are high-level methods that perform the necessary chunking when the size of the data exceeds 64 MB.
trans-unit.target: They are high-level methods that perform the necessary chunking when the size of the data exceeds 64 MB.

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_path uploads the contents of a file from the specified path, and put\_block\_blob\_from\_file uploads the contents from an already opened file/stream.
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_path uploads the contents of a file from the specified path, and put\_block\_blob\_from\_file uploads the contents from an already opened file/stream.

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes uploads an array of bytes, and put\_block\_blob\_from\_text uploads the specified text value using the specified encoding (defaults to UTF-8).
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes uploads an array of bytes, and put\_block\_blob\_from\_text uploads the specified text value using the specified encoding (defaults to UTF-8).

trans-unit.source: The following example uploads the contents of the sunset.png file into the myblob blob.
trans-unit.target: The following example uploads the contents of the sunset.png file into the myblob blob.

trans-unit.source: To list the blobs in a container, use the list\_blobs method.
trans-unit.target: To list the blobs in a container, use the list\_blobs method.

trans-unit.source: Each call to list\_blobs will return a segment of results.
trans-unit.target: Each call to list\_blobs will return a segment of results.

trans-unit.source: To get all results, check the next\_marker of the results and call list\_blobs again as needed.
trans-unit.target: To get all results, check the next\_marker of the results and call list\_blobs again as needed.

trans-unit.source: The following code outputs the name of each blob in a container to the console.
trans-unit.target: The following code outputs the name of each blob in a container to the console.

trans-unit.source: Each segment of results can contain a variable number of blobs up to a maximum of 5000.
trans-unit.target: Each segment of results can contain a variable number of blobs up to a maximum of 5000.

trans-unit.source: If next\_marker exists for a particular segment, there may be more blobs in the container.
trans-unit.target: If next\_marker exists for a particular segment, there may be more blobs in the container.

trans-unit.source: To download data from a blob, use get\_blob\_to\_path, get\_blob\_to\_file, get\_blob\_to\_bytes, or get\_blob\_to\_text.
trans-unit.target: To download data from a blob, use get\_blob\_to\_path, get\_blob\_to\_file, get\_blob\_to\_bytes, or get\_blob\_to\_text.

trans-unit.source: They are high-level methods that perform the necessary chunking when the size of the data exceeds 64 MB.
trans-unit.target: They are high-level methods that perform the necessary chunking when the size of the data exceeds 64 MB.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates using get\_blob\_to\_path to download the contents of the myblob blob and store it to the out-sunset.png file.
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates using get\_blob\_to\_path to download the contents of the myblob blob and store it to the out-sunset.png file.

trans-unit.source: Finally, to delete a blob, call delete_blob.
trans-unit.target: Finally, to delete a blob, call delete_blob.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have learned the basics of Blob storage, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have learned the basics of Blob storage, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.
